intro: Sphinctolobium floribundum, commonly known as the yellow wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with multiple leaflets and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils. Sphinctolobium floribundum plays an important role in ecological systems by fixing nitrogen and providing food for native wildlife.
